verses.esv: 14 The LORD will fight for you, and you have only to be silent.”
verses.kjv: 14 The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
verses.niv: 14 The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still."

verses.esv:
28   Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise;
    when he closes his lips, he is deemed intelligent.
verses.kjv: 28 Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
verses.niv: 28 Even a fool is thought wise if he keeps silent, and discerning if he holds his tongue.

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger;
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

verses.esv:
10   “Be still, and know that I am God.
    I will be exalted among the nations,
    I will be exalted in the earth!”
verses.kjv: 10 Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
verses.niv: 10 "Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth."

verses.esv:
11   A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.kjv: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.niv: 11 A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

verses.esv:
12   Whoever belittles his neighbor lacks sense,
    but a man of understanding remains silent.
verses.kjv: 12 He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
verses.niv: 12 A man who lacks judgment derides his neighbor, but a man of understanding holds his tongue.

verses.esv:
19   When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
    but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.
verses.kjv: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
verses.niv: 19 When words are many, sin is not absent, but he who holds his tongue is wise.

verses.esv:
7   Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him;
    fret not yourself over the one who prospers in his way,
    over the man who carries out evil devices!
verses.kjv: 7 Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
verses.niv: 7 Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him; do not fret when men succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.

verses.esv:
13   If one gives an answer before he hears,
    it is his folly and shame.
verses.kjv: 13 He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.niv: 13 He who answers before listening- that is his folly and his shame.

verses.esv:
4   Be angry, and do not sin;
    ponder in your own hearts on your beds, and be silent. Selah
verses.kjv: 4 Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
verses.niv: 4 In your anger do not sin; when you are on your beds, search your hearts and be silent. Selah

verses.esv: 3 Do not let your adorning be external—the braiding of hair and the putting on of gold jewelry, or the clothing you wear—4 but let your adorning be the hidden person of the heart with the imperishable beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which in God’s sight is very precious.
verses.kjv: 3 Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel; 4 But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.
verses.niv: 3 Your beauty should not come from outward adornment, such as braided hair and the wearing of gold jewelry and fine clothes. 4 Instead, it should be that of your inner self, the unfading beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is of great worth in God's sight.

verses.esv: 11 and to aspire to live quietly, and to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you,
verses.kjv: 11 And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you;
verses.niv: 11 Make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, to mind your own business and to work with your hands, just as we told you,

verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.esv:
20   For they do not speak peace,
    but against those who are quiet in the land
    they devise words of deceit.
verses.kjv: 20 For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
verses.niv: 20 They do not speak peaceably, but devise false accusations against those who live quietly in the land.

verses.esv:
24   “Teach me, and I will be silent;
    make me understand how I have gone astray.
verses.kjv: 24 Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
verses.niv: 24 "Teach me, and I will be quiet; show me where I have been wrong.

verses.esv: 11 and to aspire to live quietly, and to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you, 12 so that you may walk properly before outsiders and be dependent on no one.
verses.kjv: 11 And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you; 12 That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack of nothing.
verses.niv: 11 Make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, to mind your own business and to work with your hands, just as we told you, 12 so that your daily life may win the respect of outsiders and so that you will not be dependent on anybody.

verses.esv: 4 but let your adorning be the hidden person of the heart with the imperishable beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which in God’s sight is very precious.
verses.kjv: 4 But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.
verses.niv: 4 Instead, it should be that of your inner self, the unfading beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is of great worth in God's sight.

verses.esv:
26   It is good that one should wait quietly
    for the salvation of the LORD.
verses.kjv: 26 It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.
verses.niv: 26 it is good to wait quietly for the salvation of the LORD.

verses.esv:
17   The LORD your God is in your midst,
    a mighty one who will save;
  he will rejoice over you with gladness;
    he will quiet you by his love;
  he will exult over you with loud singing.
verses.kjv: 17 The LORD thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
verses.niv: 17 The LORD your God is with you, he is mighty to save. He will take great delight in you, he will quiet you with his love, he will rejoice over you with singing."

verses.esv:
8   The wise of heart will receive commandments,
    but a babbling fool will come to ruin.
verses.kjv: 8 The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
verses.niv: 8 The wise in heart accept commands, but a chattering fool comes to ruin.

verses.esv:
3   You keep him in perfect peace
    whose mind is stayed on you,
    because he trusts in you.
verses.kjv: 3 Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
verses.niv: 3 You will keep in perfect peace him whose mind is steadfast, because he trusts in you.

verses.esv: 2 Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
verses.kjv: 2 And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
verses.niv: 2 Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is--his good, pleasing and perfect will.

verses.esv:
3   Whoever guards his mouth preserves his life;
    he who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
verses.kjv: 3 He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
verses.niv: 3 He who guards his lips guards his life, but he who speaks rashly will come to ruin.

verses.esv: 35 And rising very early in the morning, while it was still dark, he departed and went out to a desolate place, and there he prayed.
verses.kjv: 35 And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
verses.niv: 35 Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.

verses.esv:
15   For thus said the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel,
  “In returning and rest you shall be saved;
    in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.”
  But you were unwilling,
verses.kjv: 15 For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
verses.niv: 15 This is what the Sovereign LORD, the Holy One of Israel, says: "In repentance and rest is your salvation, in quietness and trust is your strength, but you would have none of it.
